scripts.comment: If you want to train a model to answer questions run the following blocks.

custom-block.s: Create training and validation data from %l %br split %l %br And then do %cmdRing

Create a neural net model %txt (expert version) %br with layers %l %br using optimizer %txt %br with loss function %txt %br with activation function %txt %br with dropout rate %n %br with input size %s %br then %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

custom-block.comment: Sets up the datasets for training and creates a new deep learning model.
Click this to see details of the model and the search. Also to save your newly trained model.

custom-block.s: Test with validation and test questions
custom-block.comment: Use this to run tests with data that wasn't used in training.

custom-block.s: Make results ready for CSV export %l
custom-block.comment: Copy search history to 'results' in a form suitable for exporting to CSV. To do so check the box next to 'results' in the Variables area and right click the value displayed on the Stage.

custom-block.l: This is a simple question answering program that can answer some questions about the AI block library.

custom-block.comment: Click this to learn more about this project.

custom-block.s: Train model named %txt %n times unless no progress for %n cycles %br with learning rate %n %br and shuffle the data %b %br and use %n of the data for validation %br then when completed %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: If you want to train (or retrain) a model use a block like this.

block.comment: Click these after the search for a good model to see the history of the search.

custom-block.s: Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing
custom-block.comment: Searches for good model size and training options.

custom-block.s: Open this in a new tab

block-definition.s: Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %'prediction'

block-definition.comment: Reports the input data split into random parts whose sizes are determined by the 'fractions'.

block.comment: Delete items from this copy - not the original data.

block-definition.comment: Reports 'n' lists each 1/nth of the elements of the input list.

custom-block.l: number of elements in each part

block.var: number of elements in each part
number of elements in each part

block-definition.s: Create training and validation data from %'data' $nl split %'split' $nl And then do %'do when ready'
block-definition.comment: Given a list of lists of questions and answer keys randomly breaks it up into training, validation, and testing datasets whose sizes are given by the 'split' list. When finished runs 'do when ready'.

custom-block.comment: Creates the empty datasets that the following adds to.

custom-block.s: Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs
Send %txt data input %l output %l %br forget old data %b ( this is only for %txt ) %br then when data has been received %cs

custom-block.comment: Sets up the training and validataion data for subsquent training.

block-definition.s: Test with validation and test questions

custom-block.s: Get predictions from model(s) %txt with inputs %l %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing %br with categories %l
map %repRing on each element of %l and %l
map %repRing on each element of %l and %l
Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %l

block-definition.comment: Coverts layers list (e.g. 10 5 1) to text(e.g. 10.5.1). Useful for generating CSV files.
Replaces true and false with the corresponding textual equialent. Use for generating CSV files.

block-definition.s: Make results ready for CSV export %'original results'

block-definition.comment: Repeatedly waits for questions and answers them using a deep learning model.

block.l: Ask a question about the AI blocks.

custom-block.s: Get prediction from model(s) %s with input %s %br then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing %br with categories %l

block-definition.s: map %'reporter' on each element of %'list 1' and %'list 2'
block-definition.comment: Reports a list created by applying reporter to corresponding elements of the lists.

custom-block.s: map %repRing on each element of %l and %l

block-definition.s: get features of sentences %'sentences' $nl then do with result %'process result'
block-definition.comment: Passes a list of lists of 512 features of input 'sentences' to 'process result'.
Reports 512 features for the sentence using Google's Universal Sentence Encoder.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of 512 features for each sentence.

custom-block.s: get features of sentences %l %br then do with result %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports the text of an answer given a response from the model. Also updates the URL for further information.

custom-block.s: Categorical prediction sorted with confidence percentages %l

block.comment: Currently only responded with the highest scoring answer.

block-definition.comment: Reports a copy of the input list with all duplicates removed.
Fills the stage with 'answer'.

block.comment: If near the right edge of the stage go to a new line.

block.l: Search for good model parameters not yet started.

block-definition.s: Open this in a new tab

block-definition.comment: Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [...] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

This block carries out the given script for each item of the given list, like the primitive FOR EACH. What's different is that it provides the # variable, which will contain the item number in the list of each item in turn, 1 while processing item 1, and so on.

block-definition.s: Search and replace %'number of replacements' times $nl with number of experiments %'number of experiments' $nl with number of samples %'number of samples' $nl with %'number of training cycles' initial number of training cylces $nl do after each experiment finishes %'when an experiment finishes' $nl do after each replacement %'do with parameters' $nl then finally do %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %txt %br perform %n experiments %br where each experiment should run the same parameters %n times %br where at first run %n training cycles %br and when each experiment finishes do %cmdRing %br then process best parameters %cmdRing %br but if there is an error %cmdRing %br Varying these parameters: %br optimization method %b %br loss function %b %br activation function %b %br shuffle data %b %br number of training iterations %b %br validation split %b %br dropout rate %b %br number of layers %b %br loss weight %n %br accuracy weight %n %br duration weight %n %br size weight %n %br variance weight %n

custom-block.l: Error while searching for good parameters

block-definition.s: Get predictions from model(s) %'model name(s)' with inputs %'inputs' $nl then %'process predictions' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to make predictions for each value in 'inputs'. Can also average the predictions from a list of models.

block-definition.s: Replace model named %'model name' with the best model found $nl and when finished %'run after replacement' $nl but if there is an error %'run if there is an error'
block-definition.comment: This will replace the model named by the best model found by the 'Search for good neural net model ..." command.

block.var: run if there is an error

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.s: Load neural net from URL %'URL' $nl then when loaded %'do when loaded' $nl unless there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Loads a model previously saved using the interface on the 'tensorflow.js' page which can be opened using the 'Open support panel ...' block.

block-definition.s: Send %'kind of data' data input %'input' output %'output' $nl forget old data %'ignore old data' ( this is only for %'model name' ) $nl then when data has been received %'do when finished'
block-definition.comment: Sends either training or validation data to the support panel.
Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.

block-definition.s: Create a neural net model %'name' (expert version) $nl with layers %'layers' $nl using optimizer %'optimizer' $nl with loss function %'loss function' $nl with activation function %'activation function' $nl with dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl with input size %'input size' $nl then %'do after model created' $nl but if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Creates a neural network with a 'name' that is used in other blocks for training and prediction. 'Layers' is a list of positive numbers determine the size of each layer. The 'optimizer' is the name of the method that will be used during training. 'loss function' is used to measure the difference between predictions and outputs during training. The 'activation function' is applied after the weighted inputs are summed. 'dropout rate' adds some noise to training that helps prevent overfitting to the training data. 'Input size' should be a number or a list of numbers that describes what the input dimensions are. You don't need to provide this if you have already sent or loaded training data.

inputs.input: Stochastic Gradient DescentStochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Stochastic Gradient Descent Adaptive Learning Rate Gradiant Descent Adaptive Moment Estimation Adaptive Moment Estimation Max Momentum Root Mean Squared Prop
Mean Squared ErrorAbsolute Difference Log Loss Mean Squared Error
reluelu hardSigmoid linear relu relu6 selu sigmoid softmax softplus softsign tanh

block-definition.s: Train model named %'name' %'n' times unless no progress for %'stop after' cycles $nl with learning rate %'learning rate' $nl and shuffle the data %'shuffle' $nl and use %'validation split' of the data for validation $nl then when completed %'process response' $nl or if there is an error %'process error'
block-definition.comment: Train the model using 'n' learning steps. If three is no progress for 'stop after' cycles it will stop early. Each step will change weights by 'learning rate'. If it is too big the learning will fail. If it is too small it will go very slowly. So that the learning doesn't rely upon the order of the data it can be 'shuffled' each step. If validation data hasn't been created then an alternative is to use 'validation split' fraction of the data for validation.

block-definition.s: Get prediction from model(s) %'model names' with input %'input' $nl then %'process prediction' $nl or if there is an error %'process error' $nl with categories %'categories'
block-definition.comment: Ask the trained model to predict what the output should be for the 'input'. There is also a block for computing many predictions all at once. 'Model names' can be a list of names or a single name. Categories should only be provided if the prediction is for labelling the input.
Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; let script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; if (window.location.hostname === 'localhost') { script.src = window.location.protocol + "//" + window.location.host + "/ai/ecraft2learn-beta.js"; // notice this the beta version } else { script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; } document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

block-definition.comment: Loads any of the 'model names' if they aren't already loaded.

custom-block.s: Load neural net from URL %txt %br then when loaded %cmdRing %br unless there is an error %cmdRing

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.s: Search for good neural net model parameters for %'model name' $nl perform %'number of experiments' experiments $nl where each experiment should run the same parameters %'number of samples' times $nl where at first run %'training cycles' training cycles $nl and when each experiment finishes do %'do when a trial finishes' $nl then process best parameters %'do with best parameters' $nl but if there is an error %'process error' $nl Varying these parameters: $nl optimization method %'optimization method' $nl loss function %'loss function' $nl activation function %'activation function' $nl shuffle data %'shuffle data' $nl number of training iterations %'number of training iterations' $nl validation split %'validation split' $nl dropout rate %'dropout rate' $nl number of layers %'number of layers' $nl loss weight %'loss weight' $nl accuracy weight %'accuracy weight' $nl duration weight %'duration weight' $nl size weight %'size weight' $nl variance weight %'standard deviation weight'
block-definition.comment: This searches for the best hyperparameters (learning rate, number of training cycles, loss function, optimazation method, and layers) that results in the most accurate model. It will run 'do when a trial finishes' with the results of each experiment. Each experiment will average the results of 'number of samples' runs with the same hyperparameters. After 'number of experiments' it will run 'do with parameters' with the best parameters found. The parameters can then be passed along to the "Create and train a neural net named ... base upon ..." block. The named model must already exist and its training data (and optionally its validation data) already made available. It scores each experiment by adding the weighted values of the loss, accuracy, time to train, number of parameter, and degree of variability in the outcome scores.

block-definition.s: process best parameters %'best parameters' %'number of replacements' %'number of experiments' %'number of samples' %'initial training cycles' %'when an experiment finishes' %'do with parameters' %'when finished'

custom-block.s: Replace model named %txt with the best model found %br and when finished %cs %br but if there is an error %cmdRing

Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

custom-block.l: Error while replacing model with best model while searching.

custom-block.s: Search and replace %n times %br with number of experiments %n %br with number of samples %n %br with %n initial number of training cylces %br do after each experiment finishes %cmdRing %br do after each replacement %cmdRing %br then finally do %cmdRing

item.list: Speech synthesis,0.5817152634263039
Speech recognition,0.08269141419248882
Image recognition,0.08750802278521658
Pre-trained models,0.07762621343135834
Natural language,0.08084470779012184

Speech synthesis,"The speech synthesis library includes a block named ""speak"" that just says what you type as its input. And there a version that lets you choose the language, voice, volume, pitch, and speed of speaking. Different browsers and operating systems support different languages and voices.",/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-1.html

Speech recognition,In the speech recognition library there is a simple reporter called 'the next thing spoken' that listens for speech and reports the next things spoken. There are also full-featured blocks for doing more advanced things. These blocks work best in Chrome where there is support for over 100 languages.,/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-2.html

Image recognition,"The image recognition library includes blocks that label the contents of images using AI cloud services from Microsoft, Google, and IBM (API keys required – free usage quotas available). A more limited image recognition block runs on your device without keys and maintaining your privacy. There is a block for doing transfer learning to add new recognition labels. The ‘poses’ block reports the positon of 17 body parts of images or live video of people.",/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-3.html

Pre-trained models,There are many blocks for using pre-training models. ‘Create costume in style’ can transform any image into one of eight artist’s style. When the ‘get costume features of’ block is given an image it reports 1280 embedding numbers that can be used to measure similarity of images and to provide input for deep learning models. Pre-trained models are also used in some of the blocks for image and sound recognition.,/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html

Natural language,"There are several blocks for dealing with natural language processing. The ‘features of word’ block reports 300 numbers for any of 20,000 words in 15 languages. The ‘closest word to’ block reports the word whose embedding is closest to the input numbers. These blocks can be used to solve word analogy problems, translation, and much more. The similar ‘features of sentence’ block reports 512 numbers for any sentence. One can use this to determine semantic similarity of sentences or to generate input to deep learning models.",/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-5.html

Deep learning,"There are many blocks for creating, training, and testing neural networks. Models can be created of any size with a wide range of learning parameters. They can be trained to either produce numbers or category labels. There is a block that will search for good model parameters. Trained models can be saved and loaded into projects.",/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-6.html
